title: Unable to connect
content:
Using a MacBook Pro 2018 with macOS 12.6.1 and Firefox 104.0.2.

Lately, while going to various site, one such s Amazon and many others, I receive the following message:

Unable to connect

An error occurred during a connection to www.amazon.com. 

   The site could be temporarily unavailable or too busy. Try again in a few moments.    If you are unable to load any pages, check your computer’s network connection.    If your computer or network is protected by a firewall or proxy, make sure that Firefox is permitted to access the Web.

All three of these suggestions DO NOT WORK! I can go to many other sites without any problems. These “Unable to connect” site do connect using Safari and Google WHY not Firefox? I’ve dropped these other browsers years ago but it’s beginning to look like I’ll have to drop Firefox. Also, just to go to Firefox “Submit Feedback” or Firefox “Help”, the same thing happened, see above!

I need help and/or BETTER suggestions!
creator: samoyeds4us

title: 标签页一直崩溃

title: closing Firefox on linux from the terminal and avoiding "restore session" warnings
content:
I'm trying to just close and restart firefox from some bash scripts on Linux so that I can manage a few items from various hotkeys.

I'm trying to close an existing Firefox process "cleanly", and am running into issues with how to kill the Firefox process and have it restart without showing the "restore session" page. If I update about:config and override "browser.sessionstore.resume_from_crash" to false, then I get the behavior I'm looking for, but I'd rather not have to override this.

I've tried multiple kill signals from the `kill` command, including HUP, STOP, QUIT, TERM, INT, however all of them seem to trigger the same behavior.

So is there a way to cleanly close (or restart) Firefox from the terminal?
creator: erickj

title: Firefox browser seems to get hijacked by MS Edge.
content: I love my old HP Pavilion d7-3183, and love the way Firefox, and Trend Security software run on my laptop. But, every few days at "start-up", I'm asked to continue my Microsoft Edge setup, which I have only the option to "continue", or delay. I delay, but then my Firefox browser has to be re installed, themes, add-ons, etc. This is a problem. I believe I've exhausted the info I have to try and suppress this very annoying intrusion by MS Edge.

title: PWA Apps
content: Currently I use Firefox and Brave Browser, I want to use only Firefox, but the lack of an option to create shortcuts like in Brave is what prevents me from doing that, these shortcuts are extremely useful and practical, but in Firefox the only way to do this is through links that will open in the browser, which is practically useless because I can create shortcut links within the browser itself. I also performed a procedure in the browser's advanced settings so that I could have this option, but it doesn't work either. So I was wondering if there is any other way to do this.

title: Cookies Exceptions Don't Work
content: Well, I'm trying to make use of the option to delete cookies without deleting some that I allow, but apparently it's buggy. I want Firefox to clear cookies every time I close the browser, however, I manually added some exceptions and even then the browser deletes these exceptions when I close it, if I can add exceptions, it's so they won't be deleted when closing.

title: mancata visualizzazione
content: Buongiorno, dopo moltissimi anni che uso Firefox come browser predefinito, ho riscontrato da qualche giorno un problema nella visualizzazione di un sito, www.bet365.it, in quanto il browser non carica i contenuti del sito, accede alla pagina principale e la visualizza parzialmente, dopodichè se tento di accedere si blocca e non visualizza più niente. Con altri browser il problema non si presenta. Ho provato a fare di tutto (cookies, cronologia, ripristino del browser, e molto altro) senza risultato. Potete aiutarmi? Roberto Andretta

title: volunteer for tanslation
content:
Hi Firefox,

I'm a native speaker of Hindi and wanted to volunteer at Mozilla's to translate/localize terms in Hindi.

I tried to access the two links given on your contributor page, but those two urls give 404 not found error messages. Here're the links I'm trying to open to join the contributor's group.

1. Any new contributor wants to join Hindi, can join mailing lists of [https://lists.mozilla.org/listinfo/dev-l10n-hi Hindi Mailing List] and also join Mozilla L10N

How do I volunteer at Mozilla to do translation work in Hindi?

Thanks for your time.
creator: amank1

title: scrolling mouse su pagine web
content:
Buongiorno, ho effettuato l'aggiornamneto di ubuntu alla versione 22.04 e per avere lo stessa direzione di scrolling sia su ubuntu che su firefox per la navigazione dato che era invertito ho seguito la Vs. guida per poter reimpostare su firefox la direzione dello scroll del mouse, e fin qui tutto bene, sembrava che tutto funzionasse alla perfezione , finchè non mi accorgo che casualmente in alcuni siti è come se firefox non tenesse conto dell'impostazione e quindi il comportamento dello scroll si inverte... ho pensato che fosse causato dalla memorizzazione di tutti i dati archiviati dal browser e quindi li ho eliminati... ma niente da fare !!! e come se firefox avesse memoria di impostazioni prestabilite per quel singolo sito non tenendo conto delle nuove impostazioni....

Attendo qualche suggerimento in merito.

Cordiali Saluti Salvatore D'Alessandro
creator: sadale

title: computer very slow and freezes
content:
Since the last win 10 up grade the Firefox browser is using all RAM and CPu availability. 

I can type 2,  twenty words sentences before typing starts on the screen and then it is 1 letter at a time. IT is not Kaspersky internet security , and there is no problem if i use Google Chrome. Every indication is, that Microsoft has found a way to mess up the Firefox browser through the Google search engine, to make the Firefox use every bit of the ram and CPU to make consumers use the Google chrome browser. It would be much appreciated if the program writers can find exactly what has happened and if what I suspect is the case,  update Firefox with a patch  Regards Win 10 os 64 bit with 4gb ram, and Kaspersky internet security on a ASUS P5g41T-MLX mother board.
creator: billboyd09

title: Firefox changed my password, but didn't save it!
content:
Hey Firefox Team,

Earlier this evening, I was doing a little security update and changing the password to my Twitter and email addresses. Standard stuff. Firefox suggested a secure password and I agreed; Firefox came up with a good one. The key icon in the URL bar showed a little message that said it had saved the passwords. Hooray.

It turns out, it didn't update my passwords at all and now I am locked out of my accounts. Firefox hasn't saved these new passwords it came up with and I'm stuck with my old ones which, obviously, don't work.

What can I do?
creator: JTDJTD
